reviewText:
Not an immaculate game by any means but a very addicting and fun game. This is one of those special games that gets you hooked enough to look forward to a sequel with improved game mechanics.

The ambitions of this game is quite impressive. In gameplay, many times, all the elements will flow perfectly and the whole game will really feel like an exciting struggle for survival. Each time you go outside your compound with a character there is slight hesitation as you aren't sure if your character will survive a scavaging run, because when a character dies it is permadeath and they are gone from the game for good. Other times, various bugs will break that immersion and become frusterating. However, despite those buggy occurances, the game still shines. There is a problem where the latter half of the game will become easier as you start to horde more weapons and supplies but that is the natural side effect of becoming much better at the game. I would have liked to have seen difficulty ramp up a bit more as you go on. Though I have to admit it is satisfying nearer to the end of the game when you can just walk down mainstreet with a .45 colt and caution thrown to the wind because your characters have become survival badasses.

Overall, it's an easy game to recomend to anyone who enjoys zombie beat downs and survival/horror.

A final positive: this studio has been really dedicated in trying to resolve bugs and continue to improve their product which is a really nice thing to see.

reviewText:
It's a decent game, but I'm still giving this one as well as the Breakdown DLC a thumbs down.

The game starts out quite promising, but turns out to be repetitive and boring as soon as you've established a decent home base. The zombie sandbox seems vast at first, but excitement fades when you realize that the houses are pretty much the same everywhere. There aren't that many interesting items or people to find. And even though Breakdown seemingly adds more challenge to the game, things get pretty easy as soon as you've established a home base and started upgrading your characters.

Your neighbors are super needy, you constantly need new equipment for your home base and there's always some shmuck that has to be saved or a zombie horde that has to be mowed down. In the end you just drive repetitively from one waypoint to another until you've helped everyone with their needy needs and the game is over.

At worst the zombies are mildly annoying. The fight system doesn't offer much immersion. You just keep clicking and smash spacebar not to die". The game would have benefited from a more hands on fight system like they had in Condemned.

State of Decay had some redeeming qualities
date: mainly the way you're able to earn people's trust and create a community of survivors. The scripted events breathe life into the characters who are actually able to do some useful stuff on their own while you're completing missions. And if they die you can't bring them back. The graphics are pretty okay and there's a satisfying POK sound when your baseball bat hits an armored zombie's helmet.\n\nThe game is very ambitious
recommended: and while it doesn't suck horribly
hoursPlayed: I still feel it falls short."

reviewText:
The Definitive Single-Player Zombie Survival Game

Firstly, don't get me wrong; this game is sometimes buggy and lacks refinement. Zombies occasionally walk through walls, the clipping on certain objects is 'interesting' to say the least, and the controls are hard to get used to. But all the minor points aside, this game is hella fun.

I completed my first playthrough in 16 hours, and I've barely touched the surface on everything I could do. Many, many more hours will be spent doing everything and going everywhere I can, whilst unlocking all the Steam achivements. It's the first single-player game that's gripped me this much for a long while, and a real killer in the zombie genre.

I think it would be possible to play and survive in this game almost indefinitely - at least until you run out of certain resources, anyway. It was great fun to find and save and then play as other survivors at will, feeling a real sense of shame and disappointment when I unwittingly led one to their permanent death shortly afterwards. I've never played a game with such a persistent environment, and whilst the tutorial is lacking a lot, playing about on my own I realised there is SO much you can do. And intend to go back and do it all, now!

I highly suggest you play this game. Pronto.

reviewText:
This game is simply too much fun. I have not found any glaring faults as yet, though I do wish vehicles carried more items (a kitchen timer should not really take up the same space as a duffle bag in the back of a pickup truck) and that fully metal weapons, such as a pipe, lasted far, far longer than they do.

Deaths are real, and as a character dies you are stuck with whomever is left. While that does not change the game itself, it does limit what you are able to do later in the game if you have not been working on all the available characters' skills. I consider this a bonus, as it prevents the game from getting boring.

Vehicle stability is reminiscent of Grand Theft Auto. This is a good thing.

I have not played The Walking Dead series, so I have no basis for comparison. All I can really say, is that I have a ton of fun in this game.

reviewText: Reasonably good zombie survival game.  I'd say the most exciting moments in it are not as good as the best moments in Dead Island or Left 4 Dead 2, but the whole base building and team management thing is a great spin on this genre that makes it different from either of those two games.  I had fun playing it, but it does It have some annoyances such as camp members who run off at random times, so even after you rescue and make friends with them they aren't available to switch to most of the time when you want to.  The length of the campaign is about 15-20 hours probably and that seems about right.  I liked Dead Island's action better than this one, but that game's campaign ended up lasting much too long so by the end of the game it was just tedious.

reviewText:
I personally really enjoyed this game. The game has some bugs and glitches here and there but from my experience ive had nothing game-breaking. If you are to get the game just to kill zombies and just explore I recomend getting the Breakdown DLC. I spent most of my time on that. The story is alright but nothing too great.
A small list of some pros and cons.
Pro- Some what classic zombie, they run but can only be killed by damaging the brain.
Pro- Great mechanics such as building up a base with survivors and gear to survive the hordes, a rouge like system that has you play as multiable characters but if he/she dies you can no longer play as him/her, cars will never respawn after you destroy them.
Pro. Different types of zombie found all over the map.
Pro- A large map that has many places to settle in and explore.
Pro- Many different types of weapons from melee to guns.
Con- Zombies will glitch that causes them to not load in correctly so its just their head and arms.
Con- (personal con) I dislike the survivor walking animation.
Con- Survivor AI can glitch causes them to just stand still and die.
Con- Sadly no co-op or multiplayer. I deeply wish they added that in.

State of Decay is a pretty fun game, when your done with the base game you can always get the Breakdown DLC that makes the game harder and it ends when you die or the Lifeline DLC that ands a new map and a new story. :D

reviewText:
This game is brilliant. State of Decay is a game which is all about surviving a zombie apocalypse, but it has much more to it then you think.

The game is a lot like the walking dead, meaning When you first start out you find a group within an hour of playing the story. Then to help out the group you can do tasks like fetching supplies, or even helping out neighbours for rewards.

You can build utilities in your base, and even move bases later on in the game. If your neighbours trust you enough, they might even ask to join your group. You can also ask one of the main characters, Lilly Ritter to radio out to other survivors so they can join you, or ask if any other survivors know where food/weapons/ammo etc. can be found.

Survivors will lose hope in the group's survival, because it's still a zombie apocalyse and they're dead people trying to eat you, so you can talk to them about it and get them to blow off their steam while killing zombies or boost their esteem.

The weaponry in this game comes in different varieties, there's guns and melee weapons, but there's different types of them. for meleee weapons, there's blunt types, edged, and heavy weapons. For guns there's shotguns, snipers, handguns, and assault rifles (which are hard to find.)

Each survivor has their own pros and cons, for example one could be a good shot, but is an alcoholic, which would determine the survivor's stats. In the game, there are six slots for your character's stats. The four stats which every survivor will have is fighting, cardio, shooting, and wits. The other two can be for anything special about the character. For example, the first survivor you start out with, Marcus is a physical powerhouse, meaning you should have him using heavy weapons like sledgehammers, (my personal favourite combo) and he's also a born leader, making him one of the (best survivors in the game hint hint.) Each of those stats can be leveled up to a maximum of seven, but starting at four you can choose a perk that you can also level up seven times. Starting at level four of fighting/shooting, you can specialize in a type of gun or a type of melee weapon then level up that specialization up to seven as well.

The fighting mechanics are pretty straightforward, if you use the rolling mechanic correctly you shouldn't actually have to use guns. There isn't that much of a story, but the game is mainly focused to surviving. The game can get kind of repetitive, but this game isn't actually in a completed state yet. This is one of my favourite games of all time, and I rate this 9/10.

reviewText:
A REVIEW BASED ON HOW MUCH GAME MONEY YOU HAVE AND THE GENRES YOU LIKE

I could give you a long complicated review of the pros and cons, wheather this is a good game etc etc, but there are already hundreds of those ( and yes it is a good game).
Here is am going to tell you wheather or not you should buy it based on your favourite genres and the amount of money you have free for games.
I have picked the 3 genres/ tags that will help you decide.
So, first pick the genre or genres of games you like the most then read on from there:


IF YOUR FAVOURITE GENRE IS ZOMBIES:
This is a great zombie game that i really enjoyed. This will be one of your favourites that will go on your list of true zombie survival games. Note: all these prices are based on the presumption you are buying the game on sale
So if you have $ free:
$20+: Definatly grab this
$10-20: Grab this
$5: As long as you are not saving up for anything grab this
$0: I would suggest getting some more steam credit and buying this



IF YOUR FAVOURITE GENRE IS SURVIVAL:
This will be a decent surival game that you will remember. It lacks the basic functions such as a hunger and a food bar. However it makes up in the fact that it requires you to gather neccasary resources, and has fatigue and sickness ( as well as a few others). Note: all these prices are based on the presumption you are buying the game on sale
So if you have $ free:
$20+: Grab this, you will enjoy it
$10-20: Nothing to run out for, only grab this if you have already played the major surivivals such as
dayz, dont starve etc.
$0- 5 If you are getting more game money soon then grab it, but dont go out of your way for just this

IF YOU ENJOY BOTH SURVIVAL AND AND ZOMBIE GAMES:
Chuck what you were playing out the window and grab this!

IF YOUR FAVOURITE GENRE IS SHOOTERS
This is not a shooting game! Dont think that for one second. It has guns however you wont be using them much and they have a very slow progression. If you want to try out the other 2 listed genres then grab this but not if your looking for a shooting game!

IF YOU PLAY NONE OF THESE GENRES:
This is a good taste test for a zombie and survival game. It includes solid but not everwhelming gameplay, and should give you a good idea of wheather or not you like the genre. However if you have no urge to start playing zombie/ survival games then move on.

I hope this different type of review helped, and give it a thumbs up if it did :)

reviewText: It isn't perfect, but I find the deaths in the game to be rather unique, and the whole thing is rather challenging, and rewarding to play, and yes, this is bad grammer.\n\nTo go into full, I'd have to say, the game is worth playing, and the price is fair.  I recommend it to anyone who enjoys zombies, the combat and scavanging can get rather repetative, but the side missions and survivor tasks break it up nicely and are rather fun.  But the most unique thing about it is how they handle the character deaths.  When a character dies, they die.  You don't get a chance to reload before that happened and try again, you are moved to another survivor at your base and continue on.  I find it rather neat, if frustrating at times, since it makes it a lot more important to avoid zombie hordes when playing as the better survivors.

reviewText: Over all I freaking love this game, it is great. Having said that, there are a few ideas to be add to this awesome game that would make it, in my personal opinion, just that much better. Such as being able to place two extra ruck sacks of supplies you find into the trunk of a car for transport or four in the bed of a truck so that it isn't such a mind numbing task to drive half way across the map back and forth three or four times just to get all the supplies out of one house and back to your area of opereations. Also, maybe have the vehicles run out of fuel and have to be filled up by the use of gas cans you find around the world, so you can fill up on the go or use your fuel reserves you have stored up at your base. Maybe even have it so some of the gas stations still have a good amount of gas that you could take but say the power is out and you need to start up a generator to start the pumps but will also attract any nearby zombies, making the game more challenging so you don't just drive a car around the world just searching for supplies making you strategize how you use your precious fuel. But all and all this is one of the best zombie games I have ever played and I love it. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME if you love zombie survival games as much as I do.

reviewText:
This review was posted on 5/31/2014.

Now, I wanted to make this post about Lifeline but it wouldn't be fair to talk about only the DLC. I decided to include the game in general.

State of Decay is absolutely a must have for those who enjoy Zombie Apocalypse Simulators. The gameplay is fun, suspenseful and sometimes risks need to be taken to survive. When you have to fight zombies it's best to avoid the large groups because you WILL die, it's a problem you may have to deal with and sometimes you'll lose your favorite guy in the group. You will constantly need to restock on supplies especially after you come back, Things will happen even when you're not playing. I know because when I came back the next day there was three to five missions on my map and my supplies went down a couple digits.

I enjoyed the campaign, it was interesting and it kept my imagination trying to figure out what was going on. There were times when the game deviated from the main plot but it wasn't too bad. There was also the deal with expendable cars, if you blow up a car it's gone for good. No reparing a dead car so if you can you should make the effort to avoid hitting large crowds of zombies or your vehicle will get bent out of shape.

In the Breakdown DLC you are basically playing in sandbox mode, at the start you pick a settlement with what little supplies you have and start where you want in a small area with very few survivors. You can just focus on survival, and there is also the part where if you are able to perform certain tasks you can gain special survivors. But when you're moving on to a higher difficulty in Breakdown you can only bring a handful of your survivors so choose carefully.

I don't know much about Lifeline but I will say this, it's a refreshing change of scenery, literally. A whole new map, with a whole new storyline. It may be the same gameplay but I was surprised by how much was changed. There are some bugs but they're not game-breaking.

I personally believe this game has alot of potential and with the new DLC I certainly believe Undead Labs is in the process of something great. Take my word for it when I say, if your a fan of Zombie games this one is a must.

reviewText: I’m completely enamored with this game. Put simply this is a fun game to jump into casually. It does however have its quirks albeit random such as driving into a horde only to have your car suddenly flip high into the sky. Character then tossed from the car only to land back down again amongst the horde and devoured…. Hmmm sad day, sad day. But this is a rarity and the regular updates help keep things balanced.\n\nThe randomness however equally appeals prolonging it’s game play from the immediate main quest. If I can make an extra recommendation, grab the DLC Breakdown. The DLC is essentially for those wanting more of a challenge after fleshing out the main game. It essentially jumps in after the prolog from the main game. In part it almost feels like a prequel minus the main quests. But it’s the DLC's infinite play that gets progressively harder that has its main appeal.
